newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sumitomo Bank names Nishikawa new president.
newsitem.headline: Sumitomo Bank names Nishikawa new president.

text.p: Sumitomo Bank said on Friday that it will appoint vice president Yoshifumi Nishikawa as president, replacing Toshio Morikawa, who will become executive chairman. Both appointments are effective June 27, it said.
Chairman Sotoo Tatsumi will become adviser to the bank effective June 26, Sumitomo said.

It said two managing directors, Shigeyoshi Kato and Kensuke Hotta, will be appointed vice presidents, replacing Nishikawa and another vice president, Hiroichi Yoshida, who is scheduled to leave the bank to become president of Sumitomo's leasing unit.
